en: those of (possessive pronoun referring back to class 4 and 6 nouns)

ngiemboon: Mepɔ̀ɔn mɔ́ɔn pɔ́ me ncʉ̀ʼ nzèm wɔɔn mɔɔn.
en: Here are my bags and those of my younger brother.

ngiemboon: A la mé ńgwɔ́ tsɔ̌ fʉ̀ʼ, ...
en: At some point (far in the past),...
his (third person singular possessive pronoun referring back to class 4 and 6 nouns)
his (third person singular possessive adjective modifying class 4 and 6 nouns)
his (third person singular emphatic possessive adjective modifying class 4 and 6 nouns)
for him (third person singular possessive object pronoun referring back to class 4 and 6 nouns)

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n kaa mɔ́ɔn mekwɔ̀ʼɔ kaa, n kǎa pɔ́ mé mekwɔ̀ʼɔ.
en: I didn't carry my chairs, I carried his chairs instead.

ngiemboon: Gʉa na melÿɔʼ mɔɔn, ḿbí mé.
en: Take some of these yams for him.
What did we stop there to do?

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ gɔɔn fʉ̀ʼɔɔn ngie mè gÿo lêkɔ́?
en: Now you say what do we do?
Move the bag and place it on the bottom side.

ngiemboon: Yée míŋ wɔ̀ɔn mée! ɔ̀ lʉ̌a tà nÿɔ́g mú kwɔ́ʼte.
en: O my son! You cried so hard that your eyes bulged.

ngiemboon: À ka tè wɔ́ɔn gú, táʼ, mèŋ n ge meen gʉa.
en: He didn't invite me, but I'm going to leave anyway.
This is passable compared to that.
